results.title: Vocal Nosh
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The power of song and food brings together a community for fun and companionship. A monthly gathering at the Grainstore in Mirboo North unites people with a love for singing and a desire to connect with others in their town.
results.description: The power of song and food brings together a community for fun and companionship. A monthly gathering at the Grainstore in Mirboo North unites people with a love for singing and a desire to connect with others in their town.

results.title: Young Voices of Mirboo North
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Do you want to know what this generation really thinks? Hear from the youth of Mirboo North, as they discuss matters of importance such as their future hopes, the threat of climate change and what they would miss most about living in their town.
results.description: Do you want to know what this generation really thinks? Hear from the youth of Mirboo North, as they discuss matters of importance such as their future hopes, the threat of climate change and what they would miss most about living in their town.

results.title: Music is Sweet
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Share the joy of music with these amazing young voices from Poowong Consolidated School. Meet the kids and teachers of this inspirational primary school where writing, recording and performing songs is taught hand-in-hand with all the other standard subjects. Students of all grades are given the opportunity to express themselves through music and to perform their songs infront of their peers and the community.

results.title: Connecting Towns: A South Gippsland Cluster
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Take a tour through four small picturesque towns in South Gippsland that are combining their resources to create opportunities for growth. Here we meet some locals from Bena, Loch, Poowong and Nyora, in their places of significance as they reflect on personal memories and describe the uniqueness of where they live.
results.description: Take a tour through four small picturesque towns in South Gippsland that are combining their resources to create opportunities for growth. results.title: Artists of Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. In this film we meet painters, photographers and musicians who talk about what drew them to the area, how the weather informs their work and how the community inspire each other.
results.description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. results.title: Alternative Lifestyles
results.brief_description: From bubble-wrap insulation to a Buddhist stupa, experience alternative living in Mt Best. Meet Dr Chalko and his environmentally sustainable house and see how he converted a freezer into a fridge that uses less power per hour than a light bulb uses per day. Michael and Mary moved to Mt Best to find peace and to live in harmony with their surrounds, in the process they built a Stupa and a labyrinth in their backyard and invite anyone who wishes to come and contemplate a moment of their time.

results.title: An Interview with Douglas McLean
results.creator_credit: Douglas McLean and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.

results.title: Compression
results.brief_description: Ricky Morris is the 21st member of his family to see active service for Australia. He is proud to be part of the fighting Gunditjmarra people. His story looks at the invisible pressures modern soldiers constantly face and his realisation that this was shared by his family waiting for him at home.

results.title: Back to being black
results.brief_description: John Lovett reflects on the injustices experienced by his father and so many other indigenous war veterans who were not recognised or afforded the same benefits as their white mates when they returned from service.
results.description: John Lovett reflects on the injustices experienced by his father and so many other indigenous war veterans who were not recognised or afforded the same benefits as their white mates when they returned from service.

results.title: The Letters from Java
results.brief_description: Eric Peters only knew his dad through what records were left behind. They were mostly letters that came through the censors at a POW camp in Burma and old photos. He reflects on the sadness of not knowing his dad and the importance of bringing his spirit home to rest.
results.description: Eric Peters only knew his dad through what records were left behind. They were mostly letters that came through the censors at a POW camp in Burma and old photos. He reflects on the sadness of not knowing his dad and the importance of bringing his spirit home to rest.
